data.title: Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale)
data.meta_description: Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale)    - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
1. “Grand Finale”

2. Rounds • Written I • Mixed Bag I • Written II • Mixed Bag II • Written III • Mixed Bag III

5. India’s victory over Pakistan in cricket World Cups  Connection Round  Answers exhaustive  There are 6 questions that will lead to a common theme.  Each correct answer carries 5 marks and the connection marks are quoted in each slide. What’s in Offer…. II Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata

7. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Inspired by the ideas and style of T.S. Eliott, worked as a professor in many renowned Kolkata colleges, associated with IPTA, X was also a translator, academic and art critique in the era of modernism, post-modernism. Starting off as a symbolist, he won recognition for the musical quality of his poems, and forms the post-Tagore generation of Bengali poets. Name X.

8. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Beginning in the 1940s his non-romantic, straightforward approach heralded a new era in Bengali poetry with many poets adopting his themes. Conferred Deshikottama by the Viswa Bharati, Santiniketan, political themes, social unrest, protest by the common people and their hope and buoyancy characterize his earlier poems like Padatika, Agnikona, Chitrakuta.

9. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Martin Scorsese himself has credited a Satyajit Ray film as a major influence on his work. The protagonist Narasingh (played by Soumitra Chatterjee) is seen as a prototype for the character of the cynical cab driver Travis Bickle (played by Robert De Niro) in Martin Scorsese's Taxi Driver (1976). Identify the story writer of this Satyajit Ray film.

10. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Sometime in 2006, X made a very touching inaugural speech in some place in Germany which moved many among the listeners to tears. Inspired by the famous Raj Kapoor song, she said: “This is truly the age where the Joota (shoe) is Japani (Japanese), Patloon (pants) is Englistani (British), the Topi (hat) is Roosi (Russian), But the Dil (heart) is always Hindustani (Indian)”. Name X.

11. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Identify the story writer of this film.

12. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Adim Lata - Gulmomay, Murkho Baro, Samajik Noy, Baborer Prarthana are among those creations which have inspired a whole generation due to their unique form and feeling, and the unique "lyrical and reflective" style that portrayed a deep "sense of anguish towards the superficiality of our society and existence". Whom am I talking about?

15. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Inspired by the ideas and style of T.S. Eliott, worked as a professor in many renowned Kolkata colleges, associated with IPTA, X was also a translator, academic and art critique in the era of modernism, post-modernism. Starting off as a symbolist, he won recognition for the musical quality of his poems, and forms the post-Tagore generation of Bengali poets. Name X.

16. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Bishnu Dey

17. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Beginning in the 1940s his non-romantic, straightforward approach heralded a new era in Bengali poetry with many poets adopting his themes. Conferred Deshikottama by the Viswa Bharati, Santiniketan, political themes, social unrest, protest by the common people and their hope and buoyancy characterize his earlier poems like Padatika, Agnikona, Chitrakuta.

18. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Subhash Mukhopadhyay

19. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Martin Scorsese himself has credited a Satyajit Ray film as a major influence on his work. The protagonist Narasingh (played by Soumitra Chatterjee) is seen as a prototype for the character of the cynical cab driver Travis Bickle (played by Robert De Niro) in Martin Scorsese's Taxi Driver (1976). Identify the story writer of this Satyajit Ray film.

20. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Tarashankar Bandopadhyay

21. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Sometime in 2006, X made a very touching inaugural speech in some place in Germany which moved many among the listeners to tears. Inspired by the famous Raj Kapoor song, she said: “This is truly the age where the Joota (shoe) is Japani (Japanese), Patloon (pants) is Englistani (British), the Topi (hat) is Roosi (Russian), But the Dil (heart) is always Hindustani (Indian)”. Name X.

22. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Mahasweta Devi

23. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Identify the story writer of this film.

24. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Ashapurna Devi

25. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Adim Lata - Gulmomay, Murkho Baro, Samajik Noy, Baborer Prarthana are among those creations which have inspired a whole generation due to their unique form and feeling, and the unique "lyrical and reflective" style that portrayed a deep "sense of anguish towards the superficiality of our society and existence". Whom am I talking about?

26. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Shankha Ghosh

27. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I So, the answers are • Bishnu Dey • Subhash Mukhopadhyay • Tarashankar Bandopadhyay • Mahasweta Devi • Ashapurna Devi • Shankha Ghosh The Connect is :-- 6 Bengali authors to win India's highest literary award - Jnanpith Award

30. India’s victory over Pakistan in cricket World Cups What’s in Offer…. II Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata • 12 questions. • Infinite Bounce + Pounce. • Flat scoring of 10 points. • Half points, if any, is totally QM’s discretion.

32. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Built by Raghunath Singha II in 1655 A.D., the temple is greatly influenced by classical Bengali architecture. The temple is also known as the Keshta Raya Temple and is famous for its construction and terracotta sculptures. The Temple resembles two hut-like structures with separate angled roofs held together by a chala(tower) at the crown. What is the popular name of this temple?

34. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Jor Bangla Temple

35. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Which sanctuary has been declared by the Limca Book of Records as the world’s largest breeding colony of Asian Openbill Stork? It offers shelter to almost 164 species of birds and every year around 70,000 to 80,000 migratory birds visit the sanctuary. Every year these birds migrate here from across the India and other South Asian countries to breed.

37. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Kulik Bird Sanctuary, Raigunj

38. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata The first GM in South Asia, represented his country in the Chess Olympiads of 1984, 1990, 1994, 1996, 2002 and 2004, played his first international competition at Kolkata in 1979. Name the legendary sportsman who was awarded the GM title by FIDE in 1987.

40. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Niaz Murshed

41. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata If Calcutta was constructed by the British rulers from three villages — Gobindapur, Sutanuti and Kolikata, then what came out from the three rural settlements— Borkishonpur, Khalisani and Gondalpara?

43. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Chandannagar

44. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Lila Devi , the wife of writer Banaphool said that there were two creators of taste in Bengal, first was _____ ______ & the second was Rabindranath Tagore. The first _____ _____ opened at North Kolkata in 1885. Maharaja of Lalgola, Maharaja of Burdwaman, Raja of Natore, George the V all were its customers.

46. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Dwarik Ghose

47. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata A large part of which film was shot indoors in Kolkata, but the director Ray was careful that no one could make out it was not Varanasi and an unique lighting scheme was created that was used by Nykvist, Ingmar Bargman’s cinematographer? 10 years later, says Soumendu Ray that was how bounce light made its debut – a white screen was created overhead and light was bounced off that. The idea was that very little light enters rooms of houses in the narrow congested alleys of Varanasi.

49. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Aparajito

50. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata For 5 generations the men of P. P. Dutta & Sons have been in this business which was started by Dharani Dhar Dutta. Though it has become a little more than blind spots these days, they were installed to remind the natives of the supremacy of the Raj. The message was clear- Your time, our hostage. What business am I talking about, the most feature of which is clearly visible at BBD Bagh area?

52. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Clock Tower

53. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata The term ‘Bargee Danga’ has been derived from Bargee, which was a name given by the bengalees to the Maratha warriors. Built by the ancestors of Shri Safallya Narayan Kundu, one of such Maratha warriors in 1766, efforts are being taken now to restore the glory and all efforts are being made to maintain the royal heritage through regular upkeep. ‘Bargee Danga’ is the other name of what in WB?

55. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Itachuna Rajbari

56. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata This place known as the ‘Company Bagh’ used to be the residence of Warren Hastings, Sir John Shore and other British high ranking officials. Nothing remains of it except the mosque named “Kala Masjid” and some graves including that Nawazish Muhammad Khan himself. Which tourist place am I talking about?

58. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Motijheel, Murshidabad

59. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata The 17th Viceroy and Governor-General of India, at the time, had wished to invite a pioneering Bengali/Indian industrialist to dine at X and, when the discriminatory policy was thus exposed, a decision was taken to form Y with a membership policy not dictated by race. Y remains a popular social hub for the wealthy in the city. Ironically, despite its origins as a reaction to discrimination, Y has historically restricted membership to men. However, this was changed in 2007 and started admitting women members. Name X and Y.

61. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I X – Bengal Club; Y – Calcutta Club

62. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Which teacher at the Department of Drama at Rabindra Bharati University, Kolkata, acted in films such as Satyajit Ray’s Teen Kanya (’61) and Tapan Sinha’s Sagina Mahato (’70), apart from designing sets and costumes, and writing two popular plays, Ujan Beye (’52) and Kimbadanti (’70)?

64. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Kumar Roy

65. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Connect. • Chharpatra (ছাড়পত্র) - (Certificate, 1948) • Ghum Nei (ঘ নেই) - (Sleepless, 1950) • Purbabhas (পর্বা াস) - (Premonition, 1950) • Abhijan (অভ াে) - (Expedition, 1953, a play) • Mithe-Kadha (ভ ঠে-কড়া)- (Sweet and sour 1951) • Giti Guccha (গ ভিগুচ্ছ) - (Songs 1965)

67. Questions by Ashoke (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Books by Sukanta Bhattacharya

99. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata This is an interview taken within a film. Identify, both the movie and the interviewer.

101. Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Padatik & Simi Garewal Questions by Indranil (QLoK)

102. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata The statue at Shyambazar crossing is a poor copy of another statue of a famous British personal X . Netaji on horseback is a far fetched idea , hence the sculptor thought Statue of X would help him. This illustration by Kutty satires that issue of plagiarism . X is demanding the copyright fee from Mr. Bose. Id. X whose character was incidentally portrayed by an Oscar winning actor.

104. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I General James Outram

105. Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata The composer of this song of 1920’s was probably influenced by the folk tunes of Middle East, which he may had listened during his brief military stint in WW-I. The end part of the prelude [mukhra] has an uncanny resemblance with the 1978 chartbuster from the album titled, “Night Flight to Venus”, which too said to be inspired by the Turkish folk song Katibim. Id. both songs. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)

107. Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Questions by Indranil (QLoK)

108. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Long before the publication of ‘Two States’ by Mr. Bhagat, this Bengali novel (vis) was written by X, in a semi- autobiographical description of his love and courtship with his future wife Y and obviously, it became a best-seller. Id. both X and Y.

109. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata

111. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Buddhadeb Guha & Ritu Guha

112. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata The man in pic. was undefeated until his death despite numerous attempts of European enemies, whose motto of life was do or die. After almost two hundred fifty years, two intrepid youth, Dr. ____ _____ and Lt. George Albert ____ had started a historic journey that began on February 1, 1969 from Kolkata with the same motto and returned back after fifty six days after creating a world record. This incident created a huge inspiration in Bengal. The duo had made the tribute to this man possibly for the first time in this part of world, who was almost an unknown figure in Bengal till then. Id. the duo and how did they pay their tribute to this man?

113. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata

115. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Dr Pinaki Ranjan Chatterjee and Lt George Albert Duke. The name of their boat was KANHOJI ANGRE.

116. Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata What’s the significance of this climax-scene of the movie, for which the debutant director of the movie gave acknowledgement to another famous movie personality of Kolkata.? Id. this movie also. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)

118. Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Director of the movie, Uttam Kumar shot this particular segment at the set of the movie Nayak after taking necessary permission from ……..you know who…... Questions by Indranil (QLoK)

119. India’s victory over Pakistan in cricket World Cups Q. 7 - 12 II Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata

120. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata This polymath, was a globe-trotter too. During his travel to imperial China, he faced the Russo-Japanese War on the first decade of the 20th century. In his accounts, he described the daily life and social customs of the Chinese people in great detail. It is believed that his observation of street vendors in China, has given him the idea to invent and market a product, whose compact arrangement and portability made it popular among bachelors, at least during the first fifty years of the 20th century in Kolkata. Id. him and his invention.

122. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Indumadhab Mallick & Icmic Cooker

123. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Thomas Stockman – the chief protagonist of ‘En Folkefiende’ was the source of influence in this part of cultural hemisphere at several times. Firstly, X by the legend of Kolkata theatre on 06.12.1952. Second one is the most popular and well-known creation in 1989. And the last one, Y in 2016, where a massive improvisation made by changing the gender of the protagonist and found a namesake with a critically acclaimed Om–Nasir movie of 1990s. Identify X and Y.

125. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Dashachakra & Drohkaal

126. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata The tune of this song has been borrowed from a cult Bengali song, though the real source of the tune is the old American folk song ‘Oh By Jingo!’. Id. the hugely popular Bengali song.

128. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I

129. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Since the revival of the Sandesh magazine, under the editorship of Satyajit Ray in 1961, only once the cover illustration of the periodical was done by someone other than the members of the Ray-clan. In the 1970 May- June issue of Sandesh, we have found a different illustrator, who had designed the cover page with a full page comics. Who is that illustrator?

131. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Dipak Chakraborty

132. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Untold brave story of an unknown bengali Over two hundred Indian soldiers on a United Nations Peacekeeping Mission were taken hostage by rebels and the international community advocated patience and restraint in the face of a volatile hostage crisis, ultimately, the Indians had no choice but to take matters into their own hands to extricate their soldiers and so OPERATION KHUKRI was launched 10,000 km away from India under the leadership of a Bengali, Major Ajoy Mukherjee to rescue the 223 Gorkha Regiment soldiers from the trigger happy rebels. In which country Indian military conducted one of their successful mission overseas?

134. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Sierra Leone

135. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Connect.

137. Questions by Indranil (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Adaptation of Narendranath Mitra’s stories

141. India’s victory over Pakistan in cricket World Cups What’s in Offer…. II Questions by Somnath (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata  Written Round  All the answers contain the name of a colour  Answers are not related to any particular theme  Marks for each correct answer :-- + 05 marks (without stake) + 10 / - 05 (with stake)

143. Questions by Somnath (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata It is said to be applied for the very first time on Lord Shiva and Sati to make them look beautiful. Later adopted in the Indian subcontinent as a ritual during a particular occasion, it is still being continued with much pomp. What is being talked about?

145. Questions by Somnath (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) FAQ-2017, CMC, KolkataI I Gaye Holud

147. Questions by Somnath (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata I am looking for a ‘colourful’ venture (1957-58) of a former dermatologist of Calcutta Medical College. (Clue – These three noted gentlemen)

148. Questions by Somnath (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata This not-so-happening 2013 film came into news when a particular group of people claimed that the title was inspired by one of their iconic creations. In fact, presence of one actor among the movie’s cast made the case pretty interesting. What inspired the title of this movie?

149. Questions by Somnath (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata This former post-master in Serampore Head Post Office was later awarded the prestigious title of ‘Rai Bahadur’ by the British Govt. for services rendered at the Battle of Lushai. What’s his biggest claim to fame?

150. Questions by Somnath (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata It’s history traced back to a certain gentleman named Balaram who added a few ingredients to the recipe of the eternal-favourite one to come up with this particular variety. What has thus been originated? (Vis – Logo of an organisation associated with the family of Balaram)

185. Questions by Somnath (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Panchanan, the son of poet Parameswar Gangopadhyay had a checkered career. He was one of the Generals of the Humayun’s army which defeated the army of Sher Shah Suri and got the title ‘Shakti Khan’. He was also awarded the jageer of more than 40 villages and founded different settlements after bringing people of several occupations from the other parts of the country. Accordingly, the area occupied by the Baids (or Doctors) from Bikrampur, Dhaka came to be known as Baidyabati. How do we presently know the area where the goldsmiths settled down?

Questions by Somnath (QLoK)Bangaliyana Quiz (Grand Finale) I IFAQ-2017, CMC, Kolkata Lillian, the daughter of a senior Regimental Sergeant Major in the British Indian Army, was born in Calcutta in 1904. A very strict disciplinarian, she tried to inculcate the army-values in her son. And shortly after the end of the WWII, her only son was commissioned into the Royal Army Service Corps as a Second Lieutenant. He was an officer in the Combined Services Entertainment Section and eventually became a Captain, commanding a small depot in West Germany. But later getting bored with his Army life, he left it. How do we better know the son of Calcutta-born Lillian?
